sub_topic: Calculating the bond dissociation energy of a molecule
message_1: What is the bond dissociation energy of the carbon-hydrogen bond in methane (CH4), given that the bond enthalpy of the C-H bond is 413 kJ/mol?
message_2: The bond dissociation energy of the carbon-hydrogen bond in methane (CH4) is the energy required to break one mole of C-H bonds in the molecule. In this case, the bond enthalpy of the C-H bond is given as 413 kJ/mol. Therefore, the bond dissociation energy of the C-H bond in methane is 413 kJ/mol.
